summary.long: 1 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timothy, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, before our God and Father;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing, brethren beloved of God, your election,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how that our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit, and in much assurance; even as ye know what manner of men we showed ourselves toward you for your sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye became imitators of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that ye became an ensample to all that believe in Macedonia and in Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from you hath sounded forth the word of the Lord, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but in every place your faith to God-ward is gone forth; so that we need not to speak anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they themselves report concerning us what manner of entering in we had unto you; and how ye turned unto God from idols, to serve a living and true God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, even Jesus, who delivereth us from the wrath to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For yourselves, brethren, know our entering in unto you, that it hath not been found vain:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but having suffered before and been shamefully treated, as ye know, at Philippi, we waxed bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God in much conflict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our exhortation is not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but even as we have been approved of God to be intrusted with the gospel, so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God who proveth our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither at any time were we found using words of flattery, as ye know, nor a cloak of covetousness, God is witness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor seeking glory of men, neither from you nor from others, when we might have claimed authority as apostles of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we were gentle in the midst of you, as when a nurse cherisheth her own children:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even so, being affectionately desirous of you, we were well pleased to impart unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were become very dear to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye remember, brethren, our labor and travail: working night and day, that we might not burden any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are witnesses, and God also, how holily and righteously and unblamably we behaved ourselves toward you that believe:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as ye know how we dealt with each one of you, as a father with his own children, exhorting you, and encouraging you, and testifying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the end that ye should walk worthily of God, who calleth you into his own kingdom and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for this cause we also thank God without ceasing, that, when ye received from us the word of the message, even the word of God, ye accepted it not as the word of men, but, as it is in truth, the word of God, which also worketh in you that believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye, brethren, became imitators of the churches of God which are in Judaea in Christ Jesus: for ye also suffered the same things of your own countrymen, even as they did of the Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who both killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and drove out us, and please not God, and are contrary to all men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved; to fill up their sins always: but the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we, brethren, being bereaved of you for a short season, in presence not in heart, endeavored the more exceedingly to see your face with great desire:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we would fain have come unto you, I Paul once and again; and Satan hindered us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of glorying? Are not even ye, before our Lord Jesus at his coming?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are our glory and our joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent Timothy, our brother and God’s minister in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that no man be moved by these afflictions; for yourselves know that hereunto we are appointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For verily, when we were with you, we told you beforehand that we are to suffer affliction; even as it came to pass, and ye know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause I also, when I could no longer forbear, sent that I might know your faith, lest by any means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor should be in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Timothy came even now unto us from you, and brought us glad tidings of your faith and love, and that ye have good remembrance of us always, longing to see us, even as we also to see you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this cause, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what thanksgiving can we render again unto God for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face, and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus, direct our way unto you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we also do toward you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the end he may establish your hearts unblamable in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally then, brethren, we beseech and exhort you in the Lord Jesus, that, as ye received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, even as ye do walk,—that ye abound more and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye know what charge we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of God, even your sanctification, that ye abstain from fornication;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that each one of you know how to possess himself of his own vessel in sanctification and honor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not in the passion of lust, even as the Gentiles who know not God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that no man transgress, and wrong his brother in the matter: because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, as also we forewarned you and testified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God called us not for uncleanness, but in sanctification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he that rejecteth, rejecteth not man, but God, who giveth his Holy Spirit unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning love of the brethren ye have no need that one write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for indeed ye do it toward all the brethren that are in all Macedonia. But we exhort you, brethren, that ye abound more and more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your hands, even as we charged you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye may walk becomingly toward them that are without, and may have need of nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we would not have you ignorant, brethren, concerning them that fall asleep; that ye sorrow not, even as the rest, who have no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also that are fallen asleep in Jesus will God bring with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we that are alive, that are left unto the coming of the Lord, shall in no wise precede them that are fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven, with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then we that are alive, that are left, shall together with them be caught up in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that aught be written unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they are saying, Peace and safety, then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall in no wise escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for ye are all sons of light, and sons of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so then let us not sleep, as do the rest, but let us watch and be sober.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that are drunken are drunken in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let us, since we are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for a helmet, the hope of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God appointed us not unto wrath, but unto the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore exhort one another, and build each other up, even as also ye do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we beseech you, brethren, to know them that labor among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to esteem them exceeding highly in love for their work’s sake. Be at peace among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we exhort you, brethren, admonish the disorderly, encourage the faint-hearted, support the weak, be longsuffering toward all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that none render unto any one evil for evil; but always follow after that which is good, one toward another, and toward all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice always;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pray without ceasing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in everything give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus to you-ward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Quench not the Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: despise not prophesyings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: prove all things; hold fast that which is good;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: abstain from every form of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the God of peace himself sanctify you wholly; and may your spirit and soul and body be preserved entire, without blame at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithful is he that calleth you, who will also do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, pray for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute all the brethren with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I adjure you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
